engineering_solution: High‑performance floor and civil engineering joint sealant for movement joints exposed to pedestrians, forklifts, and chemical splash (car parks, logistics floors, water treatment). [3](https://gilar.co.il/products/%d7%a1%d7%99%d7%a7%d7%a4%d7%9c%d7%a7%d7%a1-%d7%a4%d7%a8%d7%95-3/)
coverage: ≈ 6.0 m per 600 ml sausage at 10 mm × 10 mm joint dimension. [4](https://industry.sika.com/content/dam/dms/kh01/4/sikaflex_pro-3.pdf)
pro_tip: For floor joints, use backer rod and keep bond‑breaker principle to avoid 3‑sided adhesion; clean with Sika® Aktivator/primers per substrate. [3](https://gilar.co.il/products/%d7%a1%d7%99%d7%a7%d7%a4%d7%9c%d7%a7%d7%a1-%d7%a4%d7%a8%d7%95-3/)

name: Sika Top 107
description: חומר איטום צמנטי דו-רכיבי לשימוש בחדרים רטובים, מרתפים ובריכות.

engineering_solution: 1‑part polyurethane joint sealant for façade and building envelope connections: precast concrete panels, balcony slabs, window/door frames and general construction joints. [1](https://gilar.co.il/products/%d7%a1%d7%99%d7%a7%d7%a4%d7%9c%d7%a7%d7%a1-%d7%a7%d7%95%d7%a0%d7%a1%d7%98%d7%a8%d7%a7%d7%a9%d7%9f/)
coverage: Calculated ≈ 6.0 m per 600 ml at 10×10 mm (volume rule: 600,000 mm³ ÷ 100 mm² = 6,000 mm). Use as a design estimate. [1](https://gilar.co.il/products/%d7%a1%d7%99%d7%a7%d7%a4%d7%9c%d7%a7%d7%a1-%d7%a7%d7%95%d7%a0%d7%a1%d7%98%d7%a8%d7%a7%d7%a9%d7%9f/)
pro_tip: Respect joint width/depth per Sika guidance (typically 2:1) and avoid application during large temperature swings to minimize movement while curing. [1](https://gilar.co.il/products/%d7%a1%d7%99%d7%a7%d7%a4%d7%9c%d7%a7%d7%a1-%d7%a7%d7%95%d7%a0%d7%a1%d7%98%d7%a8%d7%a7%d7%a9%d7%9f/)

engineering_solution: Low‑modulus, high movement (+100%/−50% ASTM) polyurethane sealant for façade joints in concrete, masonry and EIFS; excellent weathering and non‑staining on natural stone. [5](https://nga.sika.com/dms/getdocument.get/e2820ba2-5f2d-44c8-9a36-642cb4657d6e/sikahyflex-250-facade.pdf)[6](https://hkg.sika.com/dam/dms/hk01/5/sikahyflex_-250_facade.pdf)
coverage: Design estimate ≈ 6.0 m per 600 ml at 10×10 mm (volume equivalence). [7](https://gbr.sika.com/content/dam/dms/gb01/6/sikahyflex-250-facade.pdf)
pro_tip: For natural stone, verify non‑staining approvals; keep width ≥10 mm and maintain 2:1 width:depth to harness low modulus performance. [6](https://hkg.sika.com/dam/dms/hk01/5/sikahyflex_-250_facade.pdf)

engineering_solution: Professional perimeter sealant for window/door frames and SikaMembran® systems; adheres well to PVC and common building substrates; over‑paintable. [8](https://dnk.sika.com/content/dam/dms/dk01/h/sikahyflex_-220_window.pdf)
pro_tip: Use closed‑cell backer rod and keep 2:1 width:depth; prime per Sika pre‑treatment chart for difficult plastics/metals. [8](https://dnk.sika.com/content/dam/dms/dk01/h/sikahyflex_-220_window.pdf)

engineering_solution: Neutral‑cure sanitary silicone for glazing and wet areas (glass, enamel, ceramics); mould‑resistant and suitable for kitchens & bathrooms. [10](https://gilar.co.il/wp-content/uploads/2016/06/SikaSil-C-ENG.pdf)
coverage: Typical joint length per 300 ml varies by bead; see PDS table (e.g., several meters at 6×6 mm). Use PDS consumption table for calculation. [10](https://gilar.co.il/wp-content/uploads/2016/06/SikaSil-C-ENG.pdf)
pro_tip: In wet rooms, clean and dry substrates rigorously; tool smooth for water shed and maintain ventilation during cure. [10](https://gilar.co.il/wp-content/uploads/2016/06/SikaSil-C-ENG.pdf)

engineering_solution: 1‑component neutral silicone for interior wet areas (benchtops, basins, showers); durable mould resistance and high temperature tolerance. [11](https://aus.sika.com/en/construction/sealants-adhesives/sanitary-sealants/sikaseal-kitchenandbathroom.html)
coverage: From PDS: example joint lengths per 600 ml (e.g., 6 mm×4 mm ≈ 25 m; 9×5 ≈ 13 m; 12×6 ≈ 8 m). For 300 ml, use ~50%. [12](https://aus.sika.com/content/dam/dms/au01/a/sikaseal_kitchenandbathroom.pdf)
pro_tip: Mask edges for clean lines and remove tape before skin forms (~10–15 min); check copper/metal limitations noted in PDS. [12](https://aus.sika.com/content/dam/dms/au01/a/sikaseal_kitchenandbathroom.pdf)

engineering_solution: High‑performance, neutral silicone weatherseal for curtain wall, structural glazing weather joints, and façade perimeters; non‑streaking/non‑staining on many substrates. [13](https://industry.sika.com/content/dam/dms/gh01/1/pds-sikasil-ws-605s.pdf)
coverage: Design estimate: 600 ml ≈ 6.0 m at 10×10 mm (volume rule) for planning purposes; confirm on project. [13](https://industry.sika.com/content/dam/dms/gh01/1/pds-sikasil-ws-605s.pdf)
pro_tip: Avoid >50 °C material temperature (bubble risk); follow Sika primer chart for coated metals and plastics. [13](https://industry.sika.com/content/dam/dms/gh01/1/pds-sikasil-ws-605s.pdf)

engineering_solution: Self‑adhesive bituminous sealing tape with aluminium top film for quick repairs of gutters, roof tiles, ducts, chimneys and façade cracks. [14](https://prt.sika.com/content/dam/dms/mn01/x/sika_multiseal.pdf)
coverage: Linear coverage per roll: e.g., 10 m × 100 mm (0.1 m width) = 10 linear meters per roll (1.0 m² area). Select width per detail. [14](https://prt.sika.com/content/dam/dms/mn01/x/sika_multiseal.pdf)
pro_tip: Apply on dry, clean substrate; pre‑warm tape and substrate below 10 °C to enhance adhesion; overlap ≥50 mm. [15](https://dnk.sika.com/dam/dms/dk01/g/sika_multiseal.pdf)

engineering_solution: Multi‑position (360°) expanding PU foam for fixing/insulating around frames, penetrations and voids; provides thermal and acoustic insulation. [16](https://khm.sika.com/content/dam/dms/kh01/q/sika_boom_ap.pdf)
coverage: Yield (free foam): 500 ml ≈ 25 L; 750 ml ≈ 37–48 L depending on version. Use bead/void geometry to convert to linear meters. [17](https://idn.sika.com/dms/getdocument.get/4ef333f4-385a-44db-9319-56ee5293d888/sika-boom-ap.pdf)[18](https://www.sulmin.com.au/documents/productpdf/Z078519.pdf)
pro_tip: Pre‑dampen substrates to ensure complete cure and reduce post‑expansion; fill deep cavities in layers (mist water between passes). [16](https://khm.sika.com/content/dam/dms/kh01/q/sika_boom_ap.pdf)

engineering_solution: Nozzle‑applied, fast‑curing expanding foam for filling/insulating joints and cavities around frames, pipes and vents (interior/exterior). [19](https://grc.sika.com/dms/getdocument.get/5c88eacb-67be-438c-a568-893b552fa486/010514060000000010_SikaBoom_S_eng.pdf)
coverage: Yield (free foam): 750 ml ≈ 32 L; 500 ml ≈ 21 L. [20](https://gbr.sika.com/dms/getdocument.get/2bce8bc1-e886-40e7-8447-25c0c5056a2e/sika_boom_s.pdf)
pro_tip: Condition can to ~+20 °C; regulate flow with valve pressure and use extension tube only for small gaps (lower flow). [19](https://grc.sika.com/dms/getdocument.get/5c88eacb-67be-438c-a568-893b552fa486/010514060000000010_SikaBoom_S_eng.pdf)

engineering_solution: High‑tack construction adhesive/sealant for bonding heavy elements (stone, concrete, metals, mirrors, wood) without temporary fixing. [21](https://irq.sika.com/dam/dms/iq01/d/sikaflex-118-extremegrab.pdf)
coverage: From PDS: ~5 m of 5 mm bead per 290 ml (≈ 60 ml per linear meter; up to ~120 ml/m for heavy objects). [22](https://gcc.sika.com/dam/dms/gcc/x/sikaflex_-118_extremegrab.pdf)
pro_tip: Apply V‑cut triangular beads to maximize contact area and initial grab; ensure surfaces are clean/activated per Sika primer chart. [23](https://aus.sika.com/en/construction/sealants-adhesives/construction-adhesives/sikaflex-118-extremegrab.html)

engineering_solution: Weathering‑resistant STP (silane‑terminated) adhesive/sealant for interior/exterior seams on metals, plastics and wood—ideal for vehicle and façade trims. [24](https://usa.sika.com/content/dam/dms/us01/t/sikaflex-521-uv.pdf)
coverage: Design estimate: 600 ml ≈ 6.0 m at 10×10 mm (volume rule) for planning; actual depends on joint size. [24](https://usa.sika.com/content/dam/dms/us01/t/sikaflex-521-uv.pdf)
pro_tip: Great UV resistance without isocyanates; can be painted/sanded after cure—test paint compatibility first. [25](https://usa.sika.com/en/industry/products-solutions/adhesives-and-sealants/sikaflex/sikaflex-521-uv.html)

engineering_solution: Multipurpose polyurethane adhesive/sealant for internal sealing and simple bonding of metals, painted substrates, ceramics and many plastics. [26](https://industry.sika.com/content/dam/dms/dk01/0/sikaflex_-221.pdf)
coverage: Design estimate: 600 ml ≈ 6.0 m at 10×10 mm (volume rule). Use for preliminary take‑offs. [26](https://industry.sika.com/content/dam/dms/dk01/0/sikaflex_-221.pdf)
pro_tip: Prime sensitive plastics prone to stress cracking as advised; respect skin time (~60 min at 23 °C/50% RH). [26](https://industry.sika.com/content/dam/dms/dk01/0/sikaflex_-221.pdf)

engineering_solution: Two‑component, self‑levelling polyurethane for horizontal joints in slabs, reservoirs, and pavements; ±25–50% movement capability (grade dependent). [27](https://usa.sika.com/content/dam/dms/us01/x/sikaflex_-2c_sl.pdf)
coverage: Per gallon (3.785 L) linear feet by joint size (US PDS): e.g., 1/2"×1/4" ≈ 154 ft/gal; 3/4"×1/2" ≈ 51 ft/gal (see full table). [27](https://usa.sika.com/content/dam/dms/us01/x/sikaflex_-2c_sl.pdf)
pro_tip: Install when joint is at mid‑movement; use proper backer rod and ensure depth ≥6 mm; mix thoroughly to homogeneity. [28](https://gcc.sika.com/dms/getdocument.get/7adf25e3-3d08-4cbe-868a-aca2ec91ddd0_gcc/pds-sikaflex-2csl.pdf)

engineering_solution: Booster‑accelerated, self‑levelling polyurethane for trafficable floor/road/rail joints requiring rapid return to service and fuel resistance (diesel/jet). [29](https://gilar.co.il/products/%d7%a1%d7%99%d7%a7%d7%a4%d7%9c%d7%a7%d7%a1-406kc/)
coverage: Design by volume; density ≈1.40 kg/L. Use joint geometry to compute liters required (product supplied in 10 L pails). [30](https://gbr.sika.com/content/dam/dms/gb01/p/sikaflex_-406_kc.pdf)
pro_tip: For fast opening, add Sikaflex®‑406 KC Booster; broadcast to recess when required. Observe EN 14188‑2/EN 15651‑4 requirements. [31](https://mys.sika.com/content/dam/dms/my01/j/sikaflex_-406_kc.pdf)

engineering_solution: Hydrophilic, swellable polyurethane sealant for watertight construction joints and penetrations; also the adhesive for SikaSwell® A/P profiles. [32](https://gilar.co.il/wp-content/uploads/2016/07/Sika-Swell-S-2-EN-PDS.pdf)
coverage: Per PDS (triangular bead): 300 ml ≈ 4.1 m (12 mm), 3.1 m (15 mm), 1.8 m (20 mm); 600 ml doubles those lengths. [33](https://prt.sika.com/content/dam/dms/ie01/c/sikaswell_s-2.pdf)
pro_tip: Place on hardened concrete and allow 2–3 h to skin before pouring; ensure ≥80 mm concrete cover around the bead/profile. [32](https://gilar.co.il/wp-content/uploads/2016/07/Sika-Swell-S-2-EN-PDS.pdf)

engineering_solution: Closed‑cell polyethylene foam backer rods used to control sealant depth and prevent 3‑sided adhesion—essential for durable joint design. [34](https://nga.sika.com/dam/dms/ng01/w/sika-backing-rods.pdf)
coverage: Length per carton varies by diameter (example: Ø10 mm ≈ 400 m/carton; Ø8 mm ≈ 550 m/carton). [34](https://nga.sika.com/dam/dms/ng01/w/sika-backing-rods.pdf)
pro_tip: Select rod ~25% larger than joint width and avoid puncturing the skin; do not use with hot‑poured sealants above +70 °C. [35](https://khm.sika.com/dms/getdocument.get/678d2306-6c5b-453c-9b00-07776ce1c08e/sika_backing_rods.pdf)

engineering_solution: Neutral‑cure silicone for interior wet zones with strong mould resistance; adheres to glass, enamel, tiles, most plastics and metals. [11](https://aus.sika.com/en/construction/sealants-adhesives/sanitary-sealants/sikaseal-kitchenandbathroom.html)
coverage: PDS example per 600 ml: 6×4 mm ≈ 25 m; 9×5 mm ≈ 13 m; 12×6 mm ≈ 8 m. Use half for 300 ml cartridges. [12](https://aus.sika.com/content/dam/dms/au01/a/sikaseal_kitchenandbathroom.pdf)
pro_tip: Maintain 2:1 width:depth; clean with non‑residue solvents and avoid copper unless verified. Tool within 10–15 min. [12](https://aus.sika.com/content/dam/dms/au01/a/sikaseal_kitchenandbathroom.pdf)

engineering_solution: High‑performance FPO tape + epoxy adhesive system for sealing movement/construction joints and cracks (tunnels, water tanks, basements) with multi‑directional capability and potable water approvals. [36](https://grc.sika.com/dam/dms/gr01/j/020703900000000003_Sikadur_Combiflex_SG_System_eng.pdf)
coverage: Tape consumption by joint length/width; common rolls supplied and bonded with Sikadur® adhesives—select width to exceed joint by spec; see system PDS. [37](https://usa.sika.com/en/construction/adhesives-sealants/joint-sealants/specialty-joint-system/sikadur-combiflexsgsystem.html)
pro_tip: Surface prep is critical; round arrises, dry or matt‑damp concrete acceptable; use Sikadur‑Combiflex CF Adhesive Normal mixed 2:1 by weight/volume. [38](https://gbr.sika.com/dam/dms/gb01/a/sikadur-combiflexcfadhesivenormal.pdf)

engineering_solution: Self‑levelling grade of PRO‑3 for horizontal movement joints in floors subject to pedestrians/vehicles and splash chemicals; rapid workflow over long runs. [39](https://m.youtube.com/watch?v=Ds34Dv2F4G8)
coverage: Comparable to gun grade: ≈ 6.0 m per 600 ml at 10×10 mm (volume basis). Use PDS joint tables for exact design. [39](https://m.youtube.com/watch?v=Ds34Dv2F4G8)
pro_tip: Mask joint shoulders and avoid overfilling; maintain recess where specified for traffic wear; observe cure before opening to service. [39](https://m.youtube.com/watch?v=Ds34Dv2F4G8)

engineering_solution: Weatherproofing joint sealants for roofs and façades—used to keep building envelopes tight between dissimilar materials under UV and temperature cycling. [40](https://m.youtube.com/watch?v=QOZpeHuwNVo)
coverage: Project‑specific; use 600 ml ≈ 6.0 m at 10×10 mm as a planning rule unless PDS gives a table for the exact grade. [40](https://m.youtube.com/watch?v=QOZpeHuwNVo)
pro_tip: Select low‑modulus, non‑staining grades for façade movement joints; always test adhesion on coated metals and membranes. [40](https://m.youtube.com/watch?v=QOZpeHuwNVo)
